data.title: variety of foods for vegetarians and carnivores
data.text: the guys running this shop have tons of energy and enthusiasm-we arrived at 11 am and they were ready for us to place our lunch order! I had a yummy salad with a terrific spicy dressing. Lots of fresh choices and i liked that it was not a chain we have at home.

data.title: accidental treat
data.text: We were looking for a good salad to take back to the hotel room and accidentally stumbled upon the place.  Everyone was so nice and we really enjoyed our salad.

data.title: Great customer service!
data.text: Worth the stop. Good prices. Delicious eats. Very friendly staff. They have a large selection of pasta, rice, and wrap combos. Our group of 12 loved it!

data.title: Great lunch find that I stumbled on
data.text: I was out roaming Nashville for the day and stumbled on this place. Fresh and fast food. You can get a sandwich, wrap, or bowl with several grilled protein choices. The green salsa on my honey chicken was awesome. Great for a filling quick meal.

data.title: Nice Location, Great Hours, Average Food, Great Service
data.text: The headline is my entire review! Located in downtown a couple blocks from the Capitol, this little place serves decent food and is one of only a couple quick service eateries in downtown to stay open into the early evening. The menu board is confusing when you first walk in, but from what I found out, you don't have to do it the way they suggest. Just talk to the friendly person behind the counter. I was a bit disappointed when I ordered a grilled chicken breast and instead of throwing one on the open flamed grill, she reached in and pulled one from a container on the steam table and proceeded to chop it up in little pieces.  It was OK, but didn't have that sought-after grilled taste to it. The grilled veggies were a bit soggy as well. Would I eat there again? Yes, because as I said, if you are hungry, it is 7 pm and you are downtown and don't want to go to a sit-down restaurant, this is probably the best choice you have at that hour.

data.title: Quick, delicious, healthy
data.text:
Very pleasantly surprised by this fast-casual restaurant.  I went to the downtown Nashville location, but I understand they are also in a few other areas and cities.  The concept is similar to a few other places, with a fully custom grid menu, all-natural/organic meats, and an array of locally-sourced veggies.  What really sets GrillIt apart is the wide assortment of options, the unique flavors, and the amazing sauces.

The menu starts with a base (wrap, rice, pasta, quinoa, or salad) to which you add ingredients and if desired one or more meats.

For meats, they have four kinds of chicken (original, honey garlic, chipotle, and all-breast), organic, naturally-raised Angus steak, and seared shrimp.

For salads, you choose any or all of four kinds of lettuce (romaine, spring mix, kale, spinach).  If you like rice, they have yellow, cilantro lime, caribbean, and brown (it's so hard to find brown rice at restaurants).  If you like pasta, they have regular and whole grain.

There are 28 ingredients/toppings to choose from.  Depending on what you order, you get some number included, with a small upcharge if you go over.

My personal favorite is a custom salad with mostly romaine, some spring mix, and a touch of kale (no spinach), with steak, and feta cheese, banana peppers, diced tomatoes, diced cucumbers, diced sweet bell peppers (yellow and red), cilantro, and chick peas (garbonzo beans).  Sometimes I get guacamole instead of cilantro.  By itself this is satisfying and tasty, but what really makes it awesome is that in lieu of dressing, I get curry mustard sauce tossed in.  Oh, man, that is delicious.  It's also huge, and inexpensive.

data.title: Decent Salad
data.text: Good salad, very nice/friendly staff.  Prices in line with the general cost of Nashville.  Estblishment is clean and well kept.

data.title: Best food I had in Nashville
data.text: I almost missed this place, but I'm glad that I didn't. Had dinner one night and went back for lunch the next day it was so good.  I went with the teriyaki bowl with the green "salsa" over it.  Wow!  Knocked my socks off good.

data.title: Amazing food for the money
data.text: Okay this food is seriously amazing. At first, you might be confused as to what to order, but the staff is friendly and they guide you through the process, as well as give samples! You have to try their chicken rice bowl! I absolutely loved it! It reminds me of Chipotle, but has so much more flavor if you add their sauces which are made in house! I recommend this place, and the critics of this place are probably just jealous they can't cook fast causal food like this!

data.title: enough
data.text: We went here at noon for lunch because we had a two-fer and we like noodle bowls.  The menu has some with noodles at the base, some with rice, others that have salad greens.  There were pieces of chicken and other items on a grill, though there was no "grilling" fragrance in the concrete-floored and hard space.  Components of the various bowls are pre-chopped and in metal containers in view of customers, and one can watch the employee assembling them in one's plastic plate or bowl.  They were reasonably fresh, the staff reasonably friendly and fast, and the tables reasonably clean and available.  There was a flat-screen tv which, happily, was not on.  Decor was angular red and gray graphics, lighting adequate, lots of windows and a street view.  Nothing was especially objectionable, but nothing was especially interesting, either.  One minor quibble is that when the plastic cover was snapped on the plastic salad bowl there was not quite enough room for the plastic fork, and when I re-opened it there were fragments of black plastic on my black olive slices, romaine and tomato.

data.title: Average
data.text: They had recently opened.  The staff were friendly and helpful but the food choices were still limited.
